qas.question: Why do some people chose to go to jail for their disobedience?

answers.text: a way of continuing their protest
a way of continuing their protest
a way of continuing their protest
a way of continuing their protest

qas.question: Going to jail accomplished what goal of civil disobedience?
What is the most important item for civil disobedience to follow through?

answers.text: protest should be maintained all the way
the spirit of protest should be maintained all the way
the spirit of protest should be maintained all the way

qas.question: Why should one not go to jail?

answers.text: is to switch suddenly to a spirit of subservience
To accept jail penitently as an accession to 'the rules' is to switch suddenly to a spirit of subservience
To accept jail penitently as an accession to 'the rules' is to switch suddenly to a spirit of subservience

plausible_answers.text: as a way of continuing their protest, as a way of reminding their countrymen of injustice

qas.question: What are two reasons Conservatives went to jail?

plausible_answers.text: the spirit of protest should be maintained all the way

qas.question: What is the main point of being a Conservative and protesting?
What does Howard Zinn believe should be removed?
What does following the rules help to preserve with a protest?
What does being a Conservative do to the seriousness of a protest?

context: Howard Zinn writes, "There may be many times when protesters choose to go to jail, <b4_0>as <a0_0><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4>a way of <a0_1>continuing their protest<a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, as a way of <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>reminding their countrymen of injustice<b4_0/><a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>. But that is different than the notion that they must go to jail as part of a rule connected with civil disobedience. The key point is that <a2_2><a2_3><b5_0>the <a2_1><a2_4>spirit of <a2_0>protest<a2_4/><a2_1/> should be maintained all the way<b5_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_0/>, whether it is done by remaining in jail, or by evading it. <a3_2><a3_3>To <a3_0>accept jail penitently<a3_0/> as an accession to 'the rules' <a3_1>is to switch suddenly to a spirit of subservience<a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/>, to <b8_0>demean <b7_0>the seriousness<b8_0/> of the protest<b7_0/>...In particular, the neo-conservative <b6_0>insistence on a guilty plea<b6_0/> should be eliminated."
